references.paper_title: The Dantzig selector: Statistical estimation when p is much larger than n
references.reason: This paper introduces the Dantzig selector, a method for high-dimensional statistical estimation that is both computationally efficient and statistically sound.

references.paper_title: Square-root lasso: pivotal recovery of sparse signals via conic programming
references.reason: This paper proposes the square-root lasso, a method that provides a more accurate and robust way to recover sparse signals in high-dimensional settings.

references.paper_title: Precise error analysis of regularized M-estimators in high dimensions
references.reason: This paper provides a precise error analysis for regularized M-estimators, a widely used class of estimators in high-dimensional statistics.

references.paper_title: The noise-sensitivity phase transition in compressed sensing
references.reason: This paper examines the noise sensitivity phase transition in compressed sensing, which is a fundamental problem in signal processing and machine learning.
This paper introduces a novel approach to sparse learning that uses Boolean relaxations to obtain solutions that are both sparse and accurate.
